name: Bangladesh
funFact: It has the longest natural sea beach in the world and six distinct seasons.
info: Bangladesh is a riverine country known for the Sundarbans (home of the Royal Bengal Tiger), its massive ready-made garment industry, and a population that is incredibly passionate about cricket.

name: India
funFact: It is the birthplace of four major world religions: Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism, and Sikhism.
info: India is the world's most populous democracy, famous for the Taj Mahal, diverse spices, yoga, Bollywood, and a mix of ancient cultures.

name: United States
funFact: It has the largest economy in the world and put the first man on the moon.
info: The USA is a global superpower known for Hollywood, Silicon Valley, fast food culture, NASA, and diverse landscapes like the Grand Canyon.

name: China
funFact: It has only one time zone despite being wide enough for five.
info: China is one of the world's oldest civilizations, famous for the Great Wall, pandas, tea, kung fu, and rapid economic growth.

name: United Kingdom
funFact: No matter where you are in the UK, you are never more than 75 miles from the sea.
info: The UK is comprised of four nations, known for the Royal Family, the Beatles, Harry Potter, Big Ben, and its imperial history.

name: Brazil
funFact: It is the only country in South America that speaks Portuguese.
info: Brazil is the largest country in South America, famous for the Amazon Rainforest, Carnival, Samba, and winning the most World Cups.

name: Russia
funFact: Russia is bigger than Pluto and spans 11 time zones.
info: Russia is the largest country in the world by area, known for its harsh winters, Red Square, ballet, and trans-Siberian railway.

name: Japan
funFact: It has the highest number of vending machines per capita in the world.
info: Japan is an island nation known for advanced technology, anime, sushi, samurai history, and beautiful cherry blossoms.

name: France
funFact: It is the most visited country in the world.
info: France is the world's most visited country, famous for fashion, wine, cuisine, the Eiffel Tower, and the Louvre museum.

name: Germany
funFact: There are over 1,000 different kinds of sausages in Germany.
info: Germany is an engineering powerhouse known for luxury cars (BMW, Mercedes), Oktoberfest, castles, and bread culture.

name: Australia
funFact: There are more kangaroos than humans in Australia.
info: Australia is both a country and a continent, famous for Kangaroos, Koalas, the Great Barrier Reef, and the Sydney Opera House.

name: Canada
funFact: Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world's lakes combined.
info: Canada is the second-largest country by area, known for politeness, maple syrup, ice hockey, and stunning natural lakes.

name: Saudi Arabia
funFact: There are no permanent rivers in the entire country.
info: Saudi Arabia is the birthplace of Islam, home to Mecca and Medina, immense oil reserves, and vast Arabian deserts.

name: Egypt
funFact: The calendar of 365 days divided into 12 months was invented in Egypt.
info: Egypt is home to one of the world's oldest civilizations, the Nile River, and iconic monuments like the Great Pyramid of Giza.

name: South Africa
funFact: It is the only country in the world with three capital cities (Pretoria, Cape Town, Bloemfontein).
info: South Africa is known as the 'Rainbow Nation', famous for Nelson Mandela, diamond mining, and incredible wildlife safaris.

name: Italy
funFact: Italy has more UNESCO World Heritage sites than any other country.
info: Italy is the birthplace of the Roman Empire and Renaissance, famous for pizza, pasta, the Colosseum, and Venice canals.

name: Argentina
funFact: It has the highest number of psychiatrists per capita in the world.
info: Argentina is famous for Tango, steak, Lionel Messi, and the stunning Andes mountains and Patagonia region.

name: Mexico
funFact: The asteroid that wiped out the dinosaurs struck Mexico's Yucatan Peninsula.
info: Mexico is known for its rich Aztec and Maya history, Day of the Dead festival, tacos, and beautiful beaches like Cancun.

name: Indonesia
funFact: It has the largest Muslim population in the world and over 17,000 islands.
info: Indonesia is the world's largest archipelago with over 17,000 islands, famous for Bali, Komodo dragons, and volcanoes.

name: Turkey
funFact: Santa Claus (St. Nicholas) was born in what is now Turkey.
info: Turkey bridges Europe and Asia, famous for Istanbul, hot air balloons in Cappadocia, kebabs, and Ottoman history.

name: South Korea
funFact: In South Korea, babies are considered one year old at birth.
info: South Korea is a tech giant known for Samsung, K-Pop (BTS), Kimchi, and its rapid modernization from a war-torn past.

name: Spain
funFact: Spain produces over 40% of the world's olive oil.
info: Spain is famous for Bullfighting, Flamenco dance, sunny beaches, Real Madrid/Barcelona football, and Paella.

name: Pakistan
funFact: It produces about 50% of the world's hand-sewn footballs.
info: Pakistan is home to K2 (the 2nd highest peak), the Indus Valley civilization, and has a deep passion for cricket.

name: Nigeria
funFact: It has the largest economy and population in Africa.
info: Nigeria is the most populous country in Africa, known for its huge movie industry 'Nollywood' and Afrobeats music.

name: Thailand
funFact: It is the only Southeast Asian country never colonized by a European power.
info: Thailand is known as the 'Land of Smiles', famous for stunning beaches, ornate Buddhist temples, and spicy street food.

name: Vietnam
funFact: It is the second largest coffee exporter in the world.
info: Vietnam is famous for Ha Long Bay, delicious Pho noodle soup, motorbike culture, and being a major coffee exporter.

name: Iran
funFact: It was historically known as Persia until 1935.
info: Iran (formerly Persia) is known for world-class carpets, poetry, pistachios, and ancient ruins like Persepolis.

name: Sweden
funFact: It imports waste from other countries to power its energy plants.
info: Sweden is the home of IKEA, Spotify, Minecraft, ABBA, and is known for its high quality of life and northern lights.

name: Switzerland
funFact: It has four official languages: German, French, Italian, and Romansh.
info: Switzerland is famous for the Alps, luxury watches (Rolex), chocolate, banking secrecy, and neutrality in wars.

name: Netherlands
funFact: There are more bicycles than people in this country.
info: The Netherlands (Holland) is famous for flat landscapes, windmills, tulips, bicycles, and being mostly below sea level.

name: Ukraine
funFact: It is home to the deepest metro station in the world (Arsenalna).
info: Ukraine is known as the 'Breadbasket of Europe' due to its fertile soil, famous for sunflowers and Chernobyl history.

name: Nepal
funFact: It is the only country with a non-rectangular flag.
info: Nepal is home to Mount Everest (the highest peak in the world) and is the birthplace of Lord Buddha.

name: Colombia
funFact: It has the second highest biodiversity in the world after Brazil.
info: Colombia produces some of the world's best coffee, famous for emeralds, Shakira, and having coastlines on two oceans.

name: Philippines
funFact: It is named after King Philip II of Spain.
info: The Philippines has over 7,000 islands, famous for pristine beaches like Boracay, friendly people, and Jeepneys.

name: New Zealand
funFact: It was the first country to give women the right to vote (1893).
info: New Zealand is famous for its stunning landscapes (Lord of the Rings filmed here), Rugby (All Blacks), and Kiwi birds.

name: Singapore
funFact: It is one of only three city-states in the world.
info: Singapore is a wealthy city-state known for strict laws, extreme cleanliness, Marina Bay Sands, and diverse food.

name: Portugal
funFact: It is the oldest country in Europe with fixed borders.
info: Portugal is famous for Cristiano Ronaldo, Port wine, surfing beaches, and its history of maritime exploration.

name: Greece
funFact: It has thousands of islands, but only about 200 are inhabited.
info: Greece is the cradle of Western civilization, known for ancient philosophy, democracy, islands like Santorini, and olives.

name: Peru
funFact: The potato originated here, and there are over 3,000 varieties.
info: Peru is the home of the Inca Empire, the mysterious Machu Picchu ruins, llamas, and the source of the Amazon River.

name: Ireland
funFact: Halloween originated in Ireland as the Celtic festival of Samhain.
info: Ireland is known as the 'Emerald Isle', famous for Guinness beer, St. Patrick's Day, and its green rolling hills.

name: Poland
funFact: It is home to the world's biggest castle by land area (Malbork Castle).
info: Poland is known for its resilience in WWII, delicious Pierogi dumplings, medieval castles, and scientist Marie Curie.

name: Norway
funFact: It introduced salmon sushi to Japan in the 1980s.
info: Norway is famous for stunning Fjords, Vikings, the Nobel Peace Prize, and having immense oil wealth.

name: Belgium
funFact: It holds the world record for the longest period without a government (541 days).
info: Belgium is the HQ of the EU, famous for world-class chocolate, waffles, beer, and the Smurfs.

name: Israel
funFact: It has the highest number of museums per capita in the world.
info: Israel is the only Jewish-majority nation, famous for holy sites in Jerusalem, high-tech startups, and the Dead Sea.

name: Malaysia
funFact: It has the world's largest roundabout in Putrajaya.
info: Malaysia features the iconic Petronas Twin Towers, diverse food culture, and ancient rainforests in Borneo.

name: Chile
funFact: It is the longest country in the world from north to south.
info: Chile is the longest, narrowest country in the world, home to the driest desert (Atacama) and Easter Island statues.

name: Austria
funFact: The sewing machine was invented here by Josef Madersperger.
info: Austria is the birthplace of Mozart and classical music, known for skiing in the Alps and Vienna's historic palaces.

name: Sri Lanka
funFact: It was the first country in the world to have a female Prime Minister.
info: Sri Lanka is known as the 'Pearl of the Indian Ocean', famous for Ceylon tea, elephants, and cinnamon.

name: Kenya
funFact: It is home to the only national park located within a capital city.
info: Kenya is the safari capital of the world, home to the Maasai people and produces the world's best long-distance runners.

name: Vatican City
funFact: It is the smallest country in the world, both by area and population.
info: Vatican City is the smallest country in the world, located inside Rome, and is the headquarters of the Catholic Church.

name: North Korea
funFact: They use their own calendar based on the birth of their founder (Juche calendar).
info: North Korea is known as the 'Hermit Kingdom', one of the most secretive and isolated nations in the world.

name: Finland
funFact: There are more saunas than cars in Finland.
info: Finland consistently ranks as the happiest country, famous for Nokia, Saunas, and the home of Santa Claus (Lapland).

name: Cuba
funFact: It has one of the highest doctor-to-patient ratios in the world.
info: Cuba is famous for vintage American cars, cigars, Fidel Castro's revolution, and having no commercial advertising.

name: Morocco
funFact: The oldest university in the world is located in Fez.
info: Morocco is known for its colorful markets (Souks), the Sahara Desert, blue city Chefchaouen, and Casablanca.

name: Denmark
funFact: Their flag is the oldest continuously used national flag in the world.
info: Denmark is the birthplace of LEGO and Hans Christian Andersen, known for biking culture and 'Hygge' (coziness).

name: Iraq
funFact: The wheel was invented in ancient Iraq (Mesopotamia).
info: Iraq is known as the 'Cradle of Civilization' (Mesopotamia), the land of ancient Babylon between the Tigris and Euphrates rivers.

name: Venezuela
funFact: It has the world's highest uninterrupted waterfall, Angel Falls.
info: Venezuela has the world's largest proven oil reserves and Angel Falls, the highest uninterrupted waterfall on Earth.

name: Czech Republic
funFact: They consume the most beer per capita in the world.
info: The Czech Republic consumes the most beer per capita in the world and is famous for the historic city of Prague.

name: Hungary
funFact: The Rubik's Cube was invented here.
info: Hungary is famous for the invention of the Rubik's Cube, Budapest's thermal baths, and Goulash soup.

name: Afghanistan
funFact: The national sport involves men on horses fighting over a headless goat carcass (Buzkashi).
info: Afghanistan is a rugged, mountainous country at the crossroads of Central and South Asia, known for its complex history.

name: Qatar
funFact: It is considered the safest country in the world by some indexes.
info: Qatar is one of the richest countries per capita, hosted the 2022 FIFA World Cup, and owns Al Jazeera network.

name: Iceland
funFact: There are no mosquitos in Iceland.
info: Iceland is known as the 'Land of Fire and Ice', famous for volcanoes, glaciers, geysers, and having no mosquitos.

name: UAE
funFact: They have police cars that are Lamborghinis and Ferraris.
info: The UAE is famous for Dubai, the Burj Khalifa (tallest building), man-made islands, and luxury shopping.

name: Kazakhstan
funFact: It is the largest landlocked country in the world.
info: Kazakhstan is the world's largest landlocked country, famous for vast steppes, oil, and the Baikonur Cosmodrome.

name: Jamaica
funFact: It is the birthplace of James Bond (Ian Fleming wrote the novels there).
info: Jamaica is the birthplace of Reggae music and Bob Marley, and is famous for producing the world's fastest sprinters (Usain Bolt).

name: Croatia
funFact: The necktie (cravat) was invented here.
info: Croatia is famous for its Dalmatian coast, 1,000+ islands, and Dubrovnik (King's Landing in Game of Thrones).

name: Madagascar
funFact: 90% of its wildlife is found nowhere else on Earth.
info: Madagascar is famous for its unique biodiversity, especially Lemurs and Baobab trees, and producing most of the world's vanilla.

name: Costa Rica
funFact: It has no standing army since 1948.
info: Costa Rica has no army, runs on nearly 100% renewable energy, and is a global leader in eco-tourism.

name: Algeria
funFact: It is the largest country in Africa by land area.
info: Algeria is the largest country in Africa by land area, dominated by the Sahara desert and Roman ruins.

name: Ethiopia
funFact: They follow a calendar that is about 7 years behind the rest of the world.
info: Ethiopia is the birthplace of coffee, the only African nation never colonized, and uses a unique calendar.

name: Panama
funFact: It is the only place in the world where you can see the sun rise on the Pacific and set on the Atlantic.
info: Panama is famous for the Panama Canal which connects the Atlantic and Pacific oceans, a feat of modern engineering.

name: Mongolia
funFact: It is the most sparsely populated sovereign country in the world.
info: Mongolia is the least densely populated country in the world, famous for Genghis Khan and nomadic horse culture.

name: Fiji
funFact: Rugby is their national religion, and they won their first Olympic gold in it.
info: Fiji is a tropical paradise of 333 islands, famous for bottled water, rugby, and having 3 official languages.

name: Belarus
funFact: 40% of the country is covered by forests.
info: Belarus is famous for its vast forests (40% of land), European bison, and high consumption of potatoes.

name: Uruguay
funFact: It hosted and won the very first FIFA World Cup in 1930.
info: Uruguay hosted and won the first FIFA World Cup (1930) and has more cows than people.

name: Ghana
funFact: It was the first sub-Saharan African nation to declare independence from colonization.
info: Ghana was formerly known as the 'Gold Coast', famous for cocoa production and the colorful Kente cloth.

name: Bolivia
funFact: It has 37 official languages.
info: Bolivia is home to the Salar de Uyuni (largest salt flat) and La Paz, the highest capital city in the world.

name: Romania
funFact: It has the heaviest building in the world (Palace of the Parliament).
info: Romania is famous for the legend of Dracula (Transylvania), beautiful castles, and the Carpathian mountains.

name: Cambodia
funFact: It is the only country with a building (Angkor Wat) on its flag.
info: Cambodia is home to Angkor Wat, the largest religious monument in the world, and has a flag featuring a building.

name: Lebanon
funFact: It is the only Arab country that doesn't have a desert.
info: Lebanon has a Cedar tree on its flag, ancient Phoenician history, and is known for its delicious cuisine.

name: Jordan
funFact: The Dead Sea coast in Jordan is the lowest point on dry land on Earth.
info: Jordan is home to Petra (the Rose City carved in rock) and the Dead Sea, where you can float effortlessly.

name: Monaco
funFact: It is the second smallest country in the world and has the highest population density.
info: Monaco is a playground for the rich, famous for its casinos, Formula 1 Grand Prix, and having zero income tax.

name: Maldives
funFact: It is the flattest country on Earth, with an average elevation of only 1.5 meters.
info: The Maldives is an archipelagic nation known for its luxury overwater bungalows and incredible marine life.

name: Bhutan
funFact: It is the only carbon-negative country in the world and measures Gross National Happiness.
info: Bhutan is known as the 'Land of the Thunder Dragon', prioritizing happiness over GDP and banning tobacco sales.

name: Estonia
funFact: It was the first country to allow online voting in general elections.
info: Estonia is a digital leader (home of Skype), offering e-Residency and free public transport in its capital.

name: Zimbabwe
funFact: It once printed a 100 trillion dollar banknote during hyperinflation.
info: Zimbabwe is home to the majestic Victoria Falls and the ancient Great Zimbabwe ruins.

name: Albania
funFact: There are over 170,000 concrete bunkers scattered across the country.
info: Albania is known for having thousands of concrete bunkers from the communist era and stunning uncrowded beaches.

name: Kuwait
funFact: The Kuwaiti Dinar is the highest-valued currency in the world.
info: Kuwait is an oil-rich nation with no natural water sources, famous for its high-valued currency.

name: San Marino
funFact: It is the oldest sovereign state in the world, founded in 301 AD.
info: San Marino is a microstate completely surrounded by Italy, sitting atop Mount Titano.

name: Oman
funFact: It is the oldest independent state in the Arab world.
info: Oman is known for its ancient forts, frankincense trees, and diverse landscapes ranging from deserts to green mountains.

name: Paraguay
funFact: Its flag is unique because it has different emblems on the front and back.
info: Paraguay is a bilingual nation (Spanish & GuaranÃ­) famous for the Itaipu Dam and drinking TererÃ© (cold herbal tea).

name: Cyprus
funFact: It is the only country with its map displayed on its flag.
info: Cyprus is an island nation known for its beaches, ancient history, and being the mythical birthplace of Aphrodite.

name: Laos
funFact: It is the most heavily bombed country in history per capita.
info: Laos is known as the 'Land of a Million Elephants', famous for its laid-back lifestyle, Buddhist temples, and the Mekong river.

name: Luxembourg
funFact: It was the first country to make all public transport free.
info: Luxembourg is one of the richest countries in the world and the only remaining Grand Duchy.

name: Senegal
funFact: The Paris-Dakar Rally originally ended here.
info: Senegal is famous for Lake Retba (a naturally pink lake), its vibrant music scene, and being the westernmost point of Africa.

name: Bulgaria
funFact: It produces up to 70% of the world's rose oil.
info: Bulgaria is one of the oldest states in Europe and is where the Cyrillic alphabet was invented.

name: Slovenia
funFact: It has one of the largest populations of brown bears in Europe.
info: Slovenia is famous for Lake Bled, having a dragon as a symbol of its capital, and over 10,000 caves.

name: Brunei
funFact: The Sultan of Brunei was once the richest man in the world.
info: Brunei is a tiny, oil-rich sultanate on Borneo island where citizens pay no income tax.

name: Liechtenstein
funFact: It is the world's largest producer of false teeth.
info: Liechtenstein is one of only two doubly-landlocked countries in the world, famous for its Alpine landscapes and dental industry.

name: Tunisia
funFact: Many scenes from Star Wars (Tatooine) were filmed here.
info: Tunisia is where the ancient city of Carthage stood and is known for its beautiful Mediterranean coastline.

name: El Salvador
funFact: It was the first country to adopt Bitcoin as legal tender.
info: El Salvador is known as the 'Land of Volcanoes' and is the smallest country in Central America.

name: Tanzania
funFact: It is home to the highest peak in Africa, Mount Kilimanjaro.
info: Tanzania is the ultimate safari destination, home to the Serengeti, Ngorongoro Crater, and the spice island of Zanzibar.

name: Latvia
funFact: It has the widest waterfall in Europe (Ventas Rumba).
info: Latvia is famous for its stunning Art Nouveau architecture in Riga and lush green forests.

name: Bahamas
funFact: It has an island inhabited only by swimming pigs.
info: The Bahamas is an archipelago of 700 islands known for pristine beaches and the world's clearest water.

name: Azerbaijan
funFact: It is known as the 'Land of Fire' due to natural gas flames that never go out.
info: Azerbaijan blends East and West, famous for its futuristic Flame Towers and ancient walled city of Baku.

name: Syria
funFact: Damascus is often cited as the oldest continuously inhabited city in the world.
info: Syria is historically rich, home to some of the world's oldest cities like Damascus and Aleppo.

name: Ecuador
funFact: It is named after the Equator, which runs directly through the country.
info: Ecuador is one of the most biodiverse countries in the world, home to the Galapagos Islands and the Amazon.

name: Taiwan
funFact: It produces over 60% of the world's semiconductors.
info: Taiwan is a high-tech powerhouse famous for Taipei 101, night markets, and inventing Bubble Tea.

name: Slovakia
funFact: It produces the most cars per capita in the world.
info: Slovakia features dramatic landscapes with the High Tatras mountains and the world's highest number of castles per capita.

name: Yemen
funFact: The island of Socotra looks like an alien planet due to its unique plants.
info: Yemen is an ancient land famous for its mud-brick skyscrapers in Shibam and the alien-like Socotra Island.

name: Rwanda
funFact: Plastic bags are banned, and it is one of the cleanest countries in Africa.
info: Rwanda is known as the 'Land of a Thousand Hills' and is a global leader in wildlife conservation.

name: Lithuania
funFact: Basketball is considered the second religion of the country.
info: Lithuania was the first Soviet republic to declare independence and is famous for its Hill of Crosses.

name: Haiti
funFact: It was the first independent black republic in the world (1804).
info: Haiti shares the island of Hispaniola and is known for its successful slave revolution and vibrant art.

name: Uganda
funFact: A popular street food dish here is called a 'Rolex' (rolled eggs in chapati).
info: Uganda is known as the 'Pearl of Africa' by Winston Churchill for its stunning beauty and wildlife.

name: Bosnia
funFact: Sarajevo hosted the 1984 Winter Olympics.
info: Bosnia and Herzegovina is famous for the Stari Most bridge in Mostar and its rich blend of East-West culture.

name: Armenia
funFact: Chess is a mandatory subject in schools here.
info: Armenia was the first nation to adopt Christianity as its state religion in 301 AD.

name: Papua New Guinea
funFact: It has over 850 distinct languages, the most of any country in the world.
info: Papua New Guinea is one of the most culturally diverse countries, known for its uncontacted tribes and dense rainforests.

name: Benin
funFact: Voodoo religion originated here and is an official religion.
info: Benin is the birthplace of Voodoo and was formerly known as the Kingdom of Dahomey.

name: Uzbekistan
funFact: It is one of only two doubly-landlocked countries in the world.
info: Uzbekistan was a major hub of the ancient Silk Road, famous for its stunning blue-tiled mosques and mausoleums.

name: Mali
funFact: The Great Mosque of Djenne is the largest mud-brick building in the world.
info: Mali was once ruled by Mansa Musa, the richest person in history, and is home to the legendary city of Timbuktu.

name: Dominican Republic
funFact: Santo Domingo is the oldest permanent European settlement in the Americas.
info: The Dominican Republic shares the island of Hispaniola with Haiti and is famous for its baseball players and pristine beaches.

name: Georgia
funFact: It is considered the birthplace of wine, with a history of winemaking dating back 8,000 years.
info: Georgia sits at the intersection of Europe and Asia, famous for its ancient wine culture and stunning Caucasus mountains.

name: Angola
funFact: Its capital, Luanda, is often ranked as one of the most expensive cities in the world for expats.
info: Angola is the second-largest oil producer in Africa and is famous for originating the Kizomba dance style.

name: Serbia
funFact: It is one of the world's largest exporters of raspberries.
info: Serbia is a Balkan nation famous for its nightlife in Belgrade, Nikola Tesla museum, and tennis star Novak Djokovic.

name: Guatemala
funFact: Chocolate bars were invented by the Maya people in Guatemala.
info: Guatemala is the heart of the Mayan world, known for the ancient ruins of Tikal and beautiful Lake Atitlan.

name: Somalia
funFact: It has the longest coastline on the mainland of Africa.
info: Somalia is known as the 'Nation of Poets' and has the longest coastline in mainland Africa.

name: Moldova
funFact: It has the largest wine cellar in the world by number of bottles.
info: Moldova is famous for having the world's largest wine cellar (Milestii Mici) with nearly 2 million bottles.

name: Turkmenistan
funFact: Its capital, Ashgabat, holds the record for the highest density of white marble buildings.
info: Turkmenistan is home to the 'Door to Hell', a natural gas crater that has been burning for over 50 years.

name: Libya
funFact: It was home to the ancient city of Leptis Magna, one of the best-preserved Roman ruins.
info: Libya is mostly desert but has a long Mediterranean coastline and rich Roman history.

name: Kyrgyzstan
funFact: It has the world's largest natural walnut forest (Arslanbob).
info: Kyrgyzstan is known as 'The Switzerland of Asia' for its alpine scenery and nomadic shepherd culture.

name: Botswana
funFact: It has the world's largest concentration of African elephants.
info: Botswana is a stable democracy famous for its diamonds and the Okavango Delta, a lush wetland in a desert.

name: Nicaragua
funFact: Lake Nicaragua is the only freshwater lake in the world containing oceanic sharks (Bull Sharks).
info: Nicaragua is the largest country in Central America, known for its dramatic terrain of lakes and volcanoes.

name: North Macedonia
funFact: It has one of the oldest and deepest lakes in Europe (Lake Ohrid).
info: North Macedonia is famous for its capital Skopje, which is filled with statues, and the UNESCO site Lake Ohrid.

name: Namibia
funFact: The Namib Desert is considered the oldest desert in the world.
info: Namibia is home to the highest sand dunes in the world at Sossusvlei and the eerie Skeleton Coast.

name: Honduras
funFact: It was the original 'Banana Republic'.
info: Honduras is famous for the ancient Mayan ruins of CopÃ¡n and the diving paradise of the Bay Islands.

name: Montenegro
funFact: Its name literally means 'Black Mountain'.
info: Montenegro is a tiny Balkan country with dramatic mountains and the stunning, fjord-like Bay of Kotor.

name: Trinidad and Tobago
funFact: The steelpan is the only acoustic instrument invented in the 20th century.
info: Trinidad and Tobago is the birthplace of the Steelpan drum, Calypso music, Limbo dancing, and world-famous Carnival.

name: Sudan
funFact: It has more pyramids than Egypt.
info: Sudan contains the confluence of the Blue and White Nile and has hundreds of ancient pyramids at Meroe.

name: Bahrain
funFact: It is connected to Saudi Arabia by a 25km bridge called the King Fahd Causeway.
info: Bahrain is a small island nation in the Gulf, famous for its history of pearl diving and hosting Formula 1.

name: Andorra
funFact: It is the only country in the world where Catalan is the sole official language.
info: Andorra is a tiny principality in the Pyrenees mountains, known for ski resorts and duty-free shopping.

name: Zambia
funFact: It pioneered the concept of the 'walking safari'.
info: Zambia shares the spectacular Victoria Falls with Zimbabwe and is famous for its copper mines.

name: Guyana
funFact: It is the only English-speaking country in South America.
info: Guyana is a dense rainforest country, home to Kaieteur Falls, the world's largest single-drop waterfall by volume.

name: Malta
funFact: It has some of the oldest free-standing structures in the world (older than the Pyramids).
info: Malta is a historic archipelago in the Mediterranean, famous for the Knights of St. John and ancient temples.

name: Tajikistan
funFact: Mountains cover more than 90% of the country.
info: Tajikistan is a rugged country known as the 'Roof of the World', famous for the spectacular Pamir Highway.

name: Burkina Faso
funFact: Its name means 'Land of Incorruptible People'.
info: Burkina Faso hosts the largest film festival in Africa (FESPACO) and is known for its unique mud architecture.

name: Barbados
funFact: It is considered the birthplace of rum.
info: Barbados is a coral island famous for pristine beaches, inventing rum, and being the home of pop star Rihanna.

name: Kosovo
funFact: It has the youngest population in Europe.
info: Kosovo declared independence in 2008, making it one of the newest countries, and has a vibrant coffee culture.

name: East Timor
funFact: It is one of only two predominantly Catholic countries in Asia (along with the Philippines).
info: East Timor (Timor-Leste) is the youngest country in Asia, known for its untouched coral reefs and coffee.

name: Mauritius
funFact: It was the only known home of the Dodo bird before it went extinct.
info: Mauritius is a multicultural island nation famous for its luxury resorts, the extinct Dodo, and the Seven Colored Earths.

name: Suriname
funFact: It is the only sovereign nation outside Europe where Dutch is the primary language.
info: Suriname is a small, green country in South America, covered mostly by rainforest and famous for its cultural diversity.

name: Belize
funFact: It is the only country in Central America where English is the official language.
info: Belize is famous for the Great Blue Hole and having the second-largest barrier reef in the world.

name: Lesotho
funFact: It is the only independent state in the world that lies entirely above 1,000 meters in elevation.
info: Lesotho is known as the 'Kingdom in the Sky' because of its high altitude and is completely surrounded by South Africa.

name: Eswatini
funFact: It is the last absolute monarchy in Africa and changed its name from Swaziland in 2018.
info: Eswatini (formerly Swaziland) is known for its preserved traditions like the Reed Dance and rich wildlife.

name: Djibouti
funFact: Lake Assal is the lowest point in Africa and saltier than the Dead Sea.
info: Djibouti is a strategic hub hosting military bases for USA, China, and France, and is famous for swimming with whale sharks.

name: Solomon Islands
funFact: Some locals have naturally blonde hair despite having dark skin, a unique genetic trait.
info: The Solomon Islands saw intense fighting during WWII, famously the Battle of Guadalcanal, and is now a top diving destination.

name: Saint Lucia
funFact: It has the most Nobel Prize winners per capita of any country (2 winners for <200k people).
info: Saint Lucia is famous for the Pitons (twin volcanic spires) and having the world's only 'drive-in' volcano.

name: Sierra Leone
funFact: Its capital, Freetown, was founded as a home for repatriated former slaves in 1787.
info: Sierra Leone is famous for its diamonds and the Cotton Tree in Freetown, a historic symbol of freedom.
